title: Windows 7 and Windows 8 from USB - no iso's

forumNotes.author: LeightonJames
forumNotes.content:
Hi all

I apologise if this has already been covered on another thread however I was unable to locate it. At present I have created a bootable USB drive which contains 6 different versions of Windows 7, using the following tutorial:

[02 - How to create a USB drive that will install one of many choices of Windows OS's (Vista/Win7/Server 2008/XP) - RMPrepUSB](http://www.rmprepusb.com/tutorials/how-to-create-a-usb-drive-that-will-install-vista-win7-and-server-2008 "External link")

What I would like to do is add Windows 8 Installation sources to the Drive in the same manner. I don't want to use the new method which uses iso's. If I have to create another partition to accomodate this then that is fine.

Is anyone able to help?

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: You mean you tried it with Windows 8 and it didn't work?

forumNotes.author: LeightonJames
forumNotes.content: Yes, we tried it and it failed. Bootmgr has been compressed differently and the tools we used to create the original drive won't work on it.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Why didn't you use WIn7 bootmgr?

forumNotes.author: LeightonJames
forumNotes.content: We did. It failed on bootmgr and that lead us to track down that bootmgr has been compressed differently

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content: Not sure what you mean? Why can't you use winpe3 bootmgr and win8 BCD (bcd7)? What happens?

forumNotes.author: cdob
forumNotes.content:
> a bootable USB drive
